title: State Senator Donna Campbell Endorses Kristen Hoyt for County Judge
summary: Texas State Senator Donna Campbell (R-District 25) has endorsed Kristen Hoyt in the Republican primary for Comal County Judge. The endorsement comes as part of Hoyt's growing coalition of law enforcement and political support, which also includes endorsements from all four Comal County Constables, the Comal County Deputy Sheriff's Association, Bulverde Spring Branch Conservative Republicans, and New Braunfels Young Republicans. Hoyt, the former Tax Assessor-Collector, is running on a platform of efficiency, transparency, and fiscal responsibility in the March 3 primary election.

title: New Braunfels Officially Calls May Election with Complete Candidate Slate
summary: New Braunfels City Council officially called the May 2026 election for mayor and two council seats on February 9. Election day is set for May 2, with early voting April 20-25 and April 27-28. Incumbent Mayor Neal Linnartz faces three challengers: Michael French (communications), Angela Allen (planning commission member), and business owner Jonathon Fraizer. Council District 5's Mary Ann Labowski faces planning commissioner Chase Taylor, while District 6's April Ryan faces retail associate Nikki Shaw and engineer Steven Voges. Voter registration deadline is April 2.

title: Chamber Hosts Candidate Forum Ahead of March Primary
summary: New Braunfels Chamber of Commerce hosted a candidate forum featuring commissioners court candidates for both Comal and Guadalupe counties ahead of the March primary election. All commissioners court candidates participating were Republican. The forum also included candidates for Comal County Judge and Guadalupe County Judge positions.

title: Comal County Justice of Peace Candidates Announced for Precincts 3 & 4
summary: Early voting for the 2026 primary elections begins February 17, with Election Day March 3. Comal County Justice of the Peace races for Precincts 3 & 4 feature multiple candidates. Early voting information and candidate details are available through Comal County elections office.

title: Kristen Hoyt Earns Unanimous Law Enforcement Endorsement for Comal County Judge
summary: Kristen Hoyt, running for Comal County Judge in the March 3 Republican primary, has secured endorsements from all four Comal County Constables and the Comal County Deputy Sheriff's Association. Hoyt, a former Tax Assessor-Collector who left that position to run for judge, is campaigning on a platform of fully funding public safety and fiscally responsible governance. Early voting runs through February 27.

title: Trump Endorses Mark 'Tex' Teixeira for Texas 21st Congressional District
summary: President Donald Trump endorsed Mark 'Tex' Teixeira on February 4, 2026 to succeed Chip Roy in Texas Congressional District 21. Teixeira, a former MLB All-Star with five Gold Gloves and a World Series Championship, also holds the endorsement of Governor Greg Abbott. He is running on an America First platform focused on border security, cutting spending, and energy dominance. Early voting begins February 17.

title: Meet the Unopposed and Incumbent Candidates

title: Hundreds Gather at Wurstfest to Honor Judge Krause
summary: Community members filled the Wursthalle at Wurstfest grounds to honor the life of late Comal County Judge Sherman Krause. The memorial service brought together hundreds under colorful string lights to celebrate Krause's legacy of quiet service to the county.

title: New Braunfels Chamber Hosts Candidate Forum Ahead of Primary
summary: New Braunfels Chamber of Commerce hosted a candidate forum ahead of the March primary election. Steve Minus shared his endorsement from the New Braunfels Young Republicans and Bexar County Commissioner Grant Moody along with his background as a Comal ISD school board member.

title: Kristen Hoyt Promises Efficiency, Transparency for County Judge
summary: Former Comal County Tax Assessor-Collector Kristen Hoyt campaigns on efficiency, transparency and conservative results for taxpayers in her bid for County Judge. While her commitment to shielding Comal County from developers proved popular, counties have very limited land-use authority.

Three candidates are on the March ballot: former Tax Assessor-Collector Kristen Hoyt, business owner Deb Hindman, and firefighter Kayne Parrish.

title: 2026 ELECTIONS: Meet your candidates for Comal County Clerk
summary: Four Republican candidates are vying for the open Comal County Clerk seat being vacated by Bobbie Koepp: Ryan Bourbon-Stuart, Garrison Maurer, LeAnn Miller, and Romelle 'Melle' Walkup. Election day is March 3.

title: Candidate filing for city council positions now open to New Braunfels residents
summary: City of New Braunfels residents seeking to serve the public can now file to run for city council for the 2026 general election. Filing is open now through Feb.

title: Michael French Draws 45 to First Mayoral Town Hall
summary: Mayoral candidate Michael French drew 45 residents to his first campaign town hall at Coopers Pit Bar-B-Que, fielding questions about city issues and his vision for New Braunfels. French is one of five candidates in the mayoral race, with early voting beginning February 17.

title: Tom Clark Seeks Fourth Term as Justice of Peace Precinct 1
summary: Justice of Peace Tom Clark, a third-generation Comal County resident who was born and raised in New Braunfels, is seeking his fourth term representing Precinct 1. Early voting begins February 17 with election day March 3.

title: Christi Craddick Campaigns for Texas Comptroller in Republican Primary
summary: Current Railroad Commissioner Christi Craddick is running for Texas Comptroller, with campaign mailers reaching Comal County voters. Early voting Feb 17-27, election day March 3.

title: Comal County Clerk Race: Four Republicans Compete in March 3 Primary
summary: Four Republican candidates are vying for the open Comal County Clerk seat being vacated by Bobbie Koepp: Ryan Bourbon-Stuart, Garrison Maurer, LeAnn Miller, and Romelle 'Melle' Walkup. Early voting begins Feb 17.

title: Former MLB Star Mark Teixeira Campaigns for TX-21 Congressional Seat
summary: Former New York Yankees first baseman Mark 'Tex' Teixeira is running to succeed Rep. Chip Roy in Texas Congressional District 21, which includes Comal County. His campaign mailer emphasizes border security, defending life and 2nd Amendment rights, banning men from women's sports, and standing with President Trump.

title: New Braunfels Software Engineer Paul Rojas Runs for US House District 21
summary: Paul Rojas, a cybersecurity expert and software engineer from New Braunfels, is running in the Republican primary for US House District 21 to replace Chip Roy. The Austin American-Statesman editorial board highlighted his expertise on AI's effects on Texas jobs, land, and water.

title: Comal County Judge Candidates Profile Available
summary: Candidate profile for Comal County Judge race includes Parrish, who cites Christian values and politics in the Bible as motivation for running. Position became vacant after Judge Sherman Krause's death.

title: Comal County Commissioner Precinct 2 Candidates Announced
summary: Early voting begins February 17 for the Comal County Commissioner Precinct 2 race featuring candidates John Stratemann, Steve Minus, and Steven Rollins. Election day is March 3, 2026.

title: County Judge Seat Vacant After Passing of Sherman Krause
summary: Comal County Judge Sherman Krause passed away on February 7, 2026, leaving the county's top administrative position vacant. Commissioners Court will need to appoint a replacement or call a special election.

title: Five Candidates File for New Braunfels Mayor
summary: The New Braunfels mayoral race is shaping up with five candidates: incumbent Neal Linnartz, Michael French, Bradley Porter, Angela Allen, and Jonathon Frazier. Filing deadline is February 13, 2026.

title: Rep. Carrie Isaac Files Transportation Infrastructure Bill
summary: State Representative Carrie Isaac (R-District 73) filed a bill aimed at improving transportation infrastructure in the I-35 corridor through Comal County, citing rapid population growth as the driving factor.
